txt.en: 'King Ótek took the crown just weeks ago. The burden of our quest must lie heavy on him.'
'If the death of King Vékun was hard on Ótek, he has shown no sign of it.'
'Young prince Ingór does not put on airs. He treats even the humblest fellow-dwarf with respect.'
'These Longbeards. They think no other dwarves have ever delved a mountain.'
'Beware the Longbeards, we always say, for they may go back on their word.'
'Trust in strangers? That is a lesson long years have not taught us.'
'Just look at these strange and wonderous lands. Did our ancestors truly dwell here long ago?'
'Dragons? Even dragons pale compared to that from which we fled.'
'At our journey's end waits not rest, but work. Hard work building, settling, starting anew.'
